did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: U.S. Emergency Board No. 120 Records, 1958
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor- Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Transcript of proceedings and exhibits of the Emergency Board No. 120, 1958. Wages, benefits and crew size case. Eastern Air Lines Inc., vs. Flight Engineers International Association, EAL Chapter, 1952-1958.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: On January 21, 1958, the president appointed an Emergency Board to hear the dispute between Eastern Air Lines and its Flight Engineers. The Board consisted of David L. Cole, chairman, Saul Wallen and Dudley E. Whiting. The same people wereappointed to hear the dispute between Eastern Air Lines and the Pilots (Emergency Board #121) since one of the main issues in dispute in both cases was about whether the flight engineer should come from the engineers or the pilots.

The Flight Engineers wanted a specific guarantee that Eastern Air Lines would use only Flight Engineers on its larger aircraft, which required a third man who was responsible for the mechanical functions of the operation of the aircraft. Inaddition the Engineers wanted Improved pensions, wages, vacation time, traveling expenses and some others.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: U.S. Emergency Board No. 120 Records #5047. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
